intro: Peucedanum strictum, commonly known as narrowleaf angelica, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves that are deeply lobed. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clustered umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Peucedanum strictum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
